Hope someone out there can help...

But please, how do I attach the thing to my RCS module in a cool fashion xD

@awfulcraftdesigns
Your tiny tug will be pretty useless. The design is pretty nice but that won't help you for a number of reasons.
First: You don't have any monoprop. Without monoprop the RCS is dead. No fuel, no movement.
Second: You have RCS in only two directions. You can translate up/down and front/aft, but not left/right.
And third: With a single solar panel in only one direction and a single battery you'll soon run out of power. A single RTG will provide you with power no matter the angle or amount of sunlight.

Ah. OK. Since you clipped the tanks inside there was no way for me to know.
Just adding a Place-Anywhere 7 Linear RCS Port on either side should fix your translation shortcomings. Personally I would not replace the battery with an RTG but rather just the solar panel. Despite an RTGs continuous power generation it is only a tiny charge. The battery will provide you with a good amount when you need it and the RTG can recharge it when demand is low.

Smart thinking, I'll use the Mini One provided in RLA...and yes I do sneaky clipping...now time to insert the RTG and then you can perhaps propose ways of attaching the tug to the larger 500 Monoprop tanks?

1 minute ago, awfulcraftdesigns said:

and then you can perhaps propose ways of attaching the tug to the larger 500 Monoprop tanks?

For that a bit more information could be required. What exactly are you planning? Do you want to launch them to your station together? Or is the tug already at your station and you want to use it to move the RCS tanks?

If you launch them together it's easy. Tug-seperator-RCS
If the tug is already at your station it's even easier. Add a docking port, dock and move.

But I guess you've painted yourself into a corner by building two craft and now you can't figure out how to load both into the VAB. First load one craft and then load the second with the merge feature in the load menu. Merge will load the second craft in the VAB as if it was a sub-assembly. Now add the second to the first.

Oh, I'm planning to attach the tug to the RCS by another Juniour Docking Port, and I don't want it looking abnosixously large just to attach a tug, and as I mention previously, I wanted it to be looking sorta cool and a very sleek faring is possible. I know how to load them both into the VAB, its just how do I make them seem to fit together on the space station since personally I'd find it weird to just see two tanks of RCS and a tug attached to it, so personally I'd also taper the end with a normal Clamp-O-Tron since then I'm not losing another docking port if one is already attached if that makes sense?
